chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus D Leonard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus D Leonard

records.addlTxt: from Marilyn Booker of the County of Milwaukee District Attorney's Office, received and filed. lms

Defendant Marcus D Leonard in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

FINAL REVIEW HEARING:
Defendant has completed the parenting class and has had a sex evaluation.  Defendant has attended AODA counseling.

The defendant has complied with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction to the amended charge.

Court orders defendant to pay a fine of $200.00 plus cost, fees and surcharges, not to exceed $500.00.  Court waives any amount over $500.00.  $500.00 Bail on deposit to be applied.

Br 6 is not in session on 8-27-2015.  Pursuant to e-mail between this clerk, ADA Shomin and Attorney Chernin, case is adjourned to 8-28-2015 at 8:30 a.m. for review heairng in Branch 10.
jad
Defendant's motion to modify bail not objected to by the State and granted by the Court.

AS TO AMENDED CHARGE:
Filed, signed Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  The court reviewed the Agreement with the defendant.  
The defendant was advised of his/her constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry.
The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and found it to be in the best interest of the parties and the general public.
Case adjourned to for review hearing in Branch 10.

Defendant Marcus D Leonard in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Disorderly Conduct, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01, a Class B Misdemeanor.  Review hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marcus D Leonard in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Erin Karshen for Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.
